# The `ConstStrippingForwardingCast` Struct Template Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Provides a cast trait that strips <code>const</code> from types to make it easier to implement a const-version of a non-const cast. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Provides a cast trait that strips <code>const</code> from types to make it easier to implement a const-version of a non-const cast.

It just removes boilerplate and reduces the amount of code you as the user need to implement. You can use it like this:

template&lt;&gt; struct <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/castinfo">CastInfo&lt;foo, bar&gt;</a> &#123; ...verbose implementation... &#125;;

template&lt;&gt; struct <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/castinfo">CastInfo&lt;foo, const bar&gt;</a> : public <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/conststrippingforwardingcast">ConstStrippingForwardingCast&lt;foo, const bar, CastInfo&lt;foo, bar&gt;&gt;</a> &#123;&#125;;

Definition at line 388 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/casting-h">Casting.h</a>.
